title: So apparently Mages should rely on Blue Buff and Ocean Drakes just to be able to do to their jobs.
body:
Brilliant game design, no wonder player satisifaction is at an all time low.

How about next you make it so ADCs cant crit without red buff and infernal drakes?

The way I see it, strong waveclear mids force an even lane since they don't have to interact with the enemy. This is already bad for snowball reliant champions. Then they also have free reign to spam gank bot lane (Think ASol and Taliyah especially). This accelerates game pace naturally (cause typically one team will be able to get first tower with all the ganks), which helps the ADC on their team.

I mean look at how LCS has changed. In S3/S4 it was normal for midlaners to actually duel each other in lane and now they never need to do that because it's become an unnecessary risk. Riot should promote interaction in lane.

Ugh the 60 mana E cost though. Haven't played him yet this patch, but I'm hesitant to burn through my mana after 3 waves.

Ziggs is niche. Sona is one of those, "one of these is not like the others". Ryze is getting reworked because of pro play. Vel koz is still strong just under played, same with Viktor.

I don't know about Syndra but I'm biased towards her because she's annoying, can miss everything then ult an adc and they dead.

Ziggs is "niche" in the fact that he can both sling out spells and take turrets quickly, but he's simply outclassed by Xerath (for slinging out spells) and Jayce (on both fronts. lmao). 

Sona - Sona is a mage/enchanter hybrid which is why I included her here. No one can argue that she's god awful to play atm, however.

Vel'koz/Viktor are strong when people know what to do with them, but the learning curve is punishing and I know first hand that Viktor runs out of mana really, really quickly and that building mana items (like tear) on VIktor isn't really an option because Viktor really needs to upgrade his hextech core and tear sets him 700g behind on that front. 

Ryze is just a mess, but is one of the champions I would rather not see anyone on my team play.

Syndra is just overall weak atm and really only annoying on ARAM where she gets to take clarity and mana suddenly becomes a non-issue. 

Zyra - I would really like to see some meaningful Zyra changes/buffs because right now, I only really like playing Zyra on ARAM where it becomes "do NOT enter this zone where I have 7 of my plants or else you'll die just like these minions". He midlane is largely non-interactive because she relies so much on an AI with -50 IQ to deal damage to her opponent. Q hitbox especially is dreadful - it really only feels like a way to proc your plants rather than an actual, damaging spell.
How do you classify sona as hybrid? She's just a support.

I beg to differ. "Support" is not a class type - mages and enchanters are. While Sona primarily goes bottom lane to support the marksman carry, she brings (or should bring) 2 things to the table:
1. Mage-like qualities. This includes fairly heavy magic damage poke early and the option to build AP and burst someone down. The abilities that enhance this side of her are her passive,Q and ult. Lich Bane 
2. Enchanter-like qualities - these include spells to heal/shield her allies and provide other meaningful buffs to the team. Abilities that enhance this side of Sona are W,E and Q,W,E auras. 

So no. Sona's not a "support". She's a champion that has the qualities of both a mage and a support.

I think it's definitely valid when she goes {{item:3100}}. Seeing as how she frequently builds damage items and can contribute significantly with her own damage later in the game I think it's reasonable to say she's a mage enchanter hybrid the same way you say Taric is a tank enchanter hybrid. Janna, Soraka, and Nami are just enchanters.
